item.title: Modified Interferometer to Measure Anyonic Braiding Statistics
item.description:
Author(s): Steven A. Kivelson and Chaitanya Murthy

Existing quantum Hall interferometers measure twice the braiding phase, ${e}^{i2θ}$, of Abelian anyons, i.e., the phase accrued when one quasiparticle encircles another clockwise. We propose a modified Fabry-Pérot or Mach-Zehnder interferometer that can measure ${e}^{iθ}$.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 126605] Published Tue Sep 16, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Steven A. Kivelson and Chaitanya Murthy

Existing quantum Hall interferometers measure twice the braiding phase, ei2θ, of Abelian anyons, i.e., the phase accrued when one quasiparticle encircles another clockwise. We propose a modified Fabry-Pérot or Mach-Zehnder interferometer that can measure eiθ.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 126605] Published Tue Sep 16, 2025
